border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/P1ac580agrI\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 21:45:32 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f53e3a07ed0ee001e25dbb3?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"70adc00e6b592621f7d2d6e3c09aaba5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn44@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-44-263_b7f83ba21721f7c0.webp","destWidth":2222,"destHeight":1666,"sourceBytes":53418,"destBytes":53418,"author":"insider@insider.com (Aria Bendix)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5eac7571204ad32644504c9c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn51@2020_2/2020/09/06/02-59-50-345_e5d7f5d93e994633.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f2c32ee7924a13ad872185a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn24@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-53-855_e0684b38d9343140.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn78@2020_1/2020/09/06/02-59-58-308_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=P1ac580agrI:3FTK5TXTN8w:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn48@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-50-353_32e9749e2075a8a5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=P1ac580agrI:3FTK5TXTN8w:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn54@2020_6/2020/09/06/03-00-00-808_04dc60c797ee80cb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn60@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-52-353_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=P1ac580agrI:3FTK5TXTN8w:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn88@2020_5/2020/09/06/02-59-49-712_028e3ee37335847c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/P1ac580agrI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn48@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-44-335_737456340191661f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599361164620},{"createdTime":"2020-09-06 10:59:24","updatedTime":"2020-09-06 10:59:24","title":"Pete Buttigieg says Trump disrespected US military since the day he let a 'sucker' serve in Vietnam in his place","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/buttigieg-trump-history-of-disrespecting-military-dates-to-vietnam-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f53baea7ed0ee001e25db89?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Pete Buttigieg\" height=\"1264\" width=\"2530\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Former South Bend, Indiana, Mayor Pete Buttigieg on Friday blasted President Trump&#39;s reported 2018 comments about veterans who died in WWI.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Fox News</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Pete Buttigieg, the former mayor of South Bend, Indiana, on Friday, criticized President Donald Trump's reported comments about American soldiers who died during World War I.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2020/09/trump-americans-who-died-at-war-are-losers-and-suckers/615997/\">The Atlantic</a> on Thursday reported that during a 2018 trip to France, the president &#8212; <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump-avoided-the-military-draft-which-was-common-at-the-time-vietnam-war-2018-12\">who avoided the draft during the Vietnam War five times</a> &#8212; called fallen soldiers \"suckers\" and \"losers.\"</li>\n<li>\"This president has been disrespecting the military from the day that he let some sucker &#8212; in his view &#8212; go in his place to serve in Vietnam because he didn't want to,\" Buttiegig said during an appearance on <a href=\"https://www.foxnews.com/politics/pete-buttigieg-trump-thinks-were-all-suckers\">Fox News</a> on Friday.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Pete Buttigieg, the former candidate for president and mayor of South Bend, Indiana, blasted President Donald Trump on Friday over his recently reported remarks about American soldiers who died in combat.</p><p>On Thursday, <a href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2020/09/trump-americans-who-died-at-war-are-losers-and-suckers/615997/\">The Atlantic reported</a> that President Donald Trump in 2018 described American Marines who lost their lives during a World War I battle as \"suckers\" and \"losers\" in canceling a visit to the Aisne-Marne American Cemetery near Paris that November. He also reportedly canceled the trip due to his fears that inclement weather would disturb his hair, according to The Atlantic.</p><p>The White House and several people connected to it have since denied the accuracy of The Atlantic report, though Fox News reporter Jennifer Griffin <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fox-news-correspondent-confirms-trump-said-dead-us-troops-losers-2020-9\">said in a Twitter thread she was able to confirm some of The Atlantic's reporting</a>, which was based on reports from sources it granted anonymity. In response, Trump called on the cable news network to fire Griffin.&#160;</p><p>Other outlets, including <a href=\"https://apnews.com/b823f2c285641a4a09a96a0b195636ed\">The Associated Press</a> and <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/trump-atlantic-military-reaction/2020/09/04/b0fe0690-eec0-11ea-a21a-0fbbe90cfd8c_story.html\">The Washington Post</a>, also reported the comments first published by The Atlantic on Thursday.</p><p>As Business Insider reported noted, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-called-marines-died-wwi-losers-suckers-report-2020-9\">Trump has had a noted history of making disparaging comments about US veterans</a> — most notably, the late 2012 GOP presidential candidate and Arizona Sen. John McCain, who was held as a prisoner of war by North Vietnamese forces for more than five years during the Vietnam War.</p><p>On Twitter, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1301710819349204992\">Trump denied ever calling McCain a loser,</a> <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=541Cg2Jnb8s&feature=youtu.be&t=98amp;t=98\">despite a video</a> of him calling him doing so during a 2015 event.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Donald J. Trump  (@realDonaldTrump) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1301710816979357697?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">September 4, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>Buttigieg said Friday he wasn't buying the president's denials.&#160;</p><p>\"I mean, look, the president today lied on Twitter about never calling John McCain a loser,\" said Buttigieg<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/who-is-pete-buttigieg-bio-age-family-key-positions-2019-3\">, who served as a US Navy Reserve officer from 2009 to 2017, which included a seven-month tour as a counterintelligence officer in Afghanistan</a>.</p><p>\"Now, he's asking us to believe that, OK, he's lying about that today, because we can check and see the footage, but he's not lying about the other stuff?\" Buttigieg, who dropped out of the Democratic Party's primary race in March, added.</p><p>He continued: \"He must think we're all suckers, and the amazing thing to me is how little respect he has for the intelligence of his own supporters.\"</p><iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/2O-yG9OOEuY\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p>&#160;</p><p>According to a previous Business Insider report, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump-avoided-the-military-draft-which-was-common-at-the-time-vietnam-war-2018-12\">President Donald Trump avoided the military draft five times during the Vietnam war</a> — four times for being enrolled and college and once for having bone spurs.</p><p>\"This president has been disrespecting the military from the day that he let some sucker — in his view — go in his place to serve in Vietnam because he didn't want to,\" Buttigieg said.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 10:59:24","updatedTime":"2020-09-06 10:59:24","title":"A negative coronavirus test result will be required to board a flight to China from the US","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-visitors-need-negative-coronavirus-test-results-to-enter-china-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f53bcbee6ff30001d4e74e1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"covid airport\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A general view of the departure hall of Terminal 1 at JFK airport on May 15, 2020. There are virtually no travelers during COVID-19 pandemic at the airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lev Radin/Pacific Press/LightRocket via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Non-Chinese citizens taking a direct flight from the US to China will need to provide negative coronavirus test results, China's US embassy announced <a href=\"http://www.china-embassy.org/eng/visas/zyxx/t1812479.htm\">in a notice on Friday</a></li>\n<li>Starting on September 15, China-bound flight passengers from the US will need coronavirus test results issued within three days of boarding, according to the notice.&#160;</li>\n<li>In early June, the US <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-will-allow-limited-flights-by-chinese-airlines-not-a-ban-2020-6\">dialed back from intended plans</a> to ban Chinese airlines from flying to the US shortly after <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/china-eases-flight-curbs-after-united-states-targets-its-carriers-2020-6\">China eased airline restrictions</a> to allow more foreign flights into the country.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Passengers flying from the US to China will be required to provide negative coronavirus test results issued within 72 hours of boarding, according to a new notice <a href=\"http://www.china-embassy.org/eng/visas/zyxx/t1812479.htm\">from China's embassy in the US</a> on Friday.&#160;</p><p>Effective September 15th, non-Chinese citizens who take a direct China-bound flight from the US will need to provide negative test results ahead of boarding, according to the notice. Passengers who are transiting in the US are required to present a verified Health Declaration Form to the airlines, the notice stated.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-us-china-entering-new-cold-war-amid-coronavirus-2020-5\">Tensions between the US and China</a> have heightened during the coronavirus pandemic, and have manifested between the two nations' airlines. In early June<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-administration-to-ban-chinese-airlines-from-flying-to-us-2020-6\">, the Trump administration intended to ban Chinese airlines</a> from entering the US as <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/03/business/trump-china-flights-ban.html?login=email&auth=login-emailmail\">China tightened restrictions for foreign flights</a> from entering the country. The US government claimed the Chinese government \"made it impossible for US airlines to resume service to China,\" <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-china-exclusiv/exclusive-u-s-accuses-china-of-blocking-u-s-flights-demands-action-idUSKBN22Z04W\">according to a Reuters report.</a></p><p>After <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/china-eases-flight-curbs-after-united-states-targets-its-carriers-2020-6\">China eased airline restrictions</a> to allow more China-bound foreign flights to enter, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-will-allow-limited-flights-by-chinese-airlines-not-a-ban-2020-6\">the US dialed back its original plans to ban</a> to allow a limited number of Chinese airlines to operate flights to the US.&#160;</p><p>Meanwhile, the number of coronavirus cases in the US remains high — a total of 6.2 million coronavirus cases were confirmed as of Friday, according to <a href=\"https://coronavirus.jhu.edu/us-map\">Johns Hopkins University.</a> Meanwhile, China confirmed a total of 90,008 cases, according to <a href=\"https://coronavirus.jhu.edu/us-map\">Johns Hopkins University.</a> In Wuhan, where the coronavirus outbreak began, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/photos-us-has-the-worst-coronavirus-response-in-the-world-2020-9#in-wuhan-china-more-than-1-million-children-went-back-to-school-this-week-1\">more than 1 million children have resumed in-person classes.</a></p><ul class=\"read-more-links\"><li>Read more:</li><li><a Cold War that could devastate the global economy</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-majority-of-americans-blame-china-for-spread-2020-7\" data-read-more-link=\"\" class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Cars from the LAPD's fleet of barely used BMW i3s are being sold at New Century BMW in Alhambra, California.&#160;</li>\n<li>The cars all have pretty low miles and are all priced between $15,000 and $18,000, a dealership rep told Business Insider.</li>\n<li>The dealership sold its first shipment of 28 cars in just four days, but a new shipment is coming this month.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>In 2016, <a href=\"https://www.press.bmwgroup.com/usa/article/detail/T0260946EN_US/bmw-of-north-america-wins-bid-to-supply-the-los-angeles-police-department-with-100-bmw-i3-electric-vehicles\">BMW won the bid</a> to supply the Los Angeles Police Department with hundreds of all-electric BMW i3s for use in its transportation fleet. The LAPD hardly used them, their leases expired, and now the cars are being sold for dirt cheap.</p><p>Several i3s from the LAPD's fleet were for sale at <a href=\"https://www.newcenturybmw.com/\">New Century BMW</a> as Certified Pre-Owned models, as first noticed by <a href=\"https://thecurrentreview.com/News/Heres-Where-LAPDs-BMW-i3-Fleet-is-Now/#wbb1\">The Current Review</a>, an enthusiast EV blog, and then <a href=\"https://jalopnik.com/the-lapds-costly-bmw-i3-fleet-is-being-sold-for-basical-1844943216\">Jalopnik</a>.&#160;A screenshot of New Century BMW's inventory, grabbed by <a href=\"https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1129430_used-bmw-i3-police-cars-offered-up-in-la-electric-car-deal-or-not\">Green Car Reports</a>, showed a collection of white-on-black i3s available. All of them were 2017 models, only had a few thousand miles on them, and were priced at less than $18,000.&#160;</p><p>A representative at New Century BMW confirmed to Business Insider that the cars were indeed from the LAPD's fleet, and that the dealership was selling them as CPO models. Some prices were as low as $15,000, which is a steal for a three-year-old, low-mileage CPO BMW <a href=\"https://www.kbb.com/bmw/i3/2017/#:~:text=The%20Manufacturer's%20Suggested%20Retail%20Price,with%20the%20Range%20Extender%2C%20%2448%2C445.\">that had a starting price of more than $43,000</a>. Some had only about 9,000 miles on them.</p><p>A cursory glance through Autotrader shows 2017 BMW i3s with more miles on them going for a few thousand dollars more.&#160;</p><p>At the time of Friday's writing, there are no more LAPD i3s left for sale. The dealership rep told Business Insider that the store's first shipment of i3s contained 28 cars and all of them sold in four days.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5297bb7ed0ee001e25da54?format=jpeg\" alt=\"P90222767_highRes_los angeles police d\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>LAPD BMW i3.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BMW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>However, a second shipment will come at some point this month, and the rep said all of the cars would be priced between $15,000 and $18,000.&#160;</p><p>The rep estimates that these will sell just as quickly. He said there was a lot of interest, but also noted that due to the high demand, the dealer will not be accepting phone or online orders. Interested customers must show up in person at the dealership and the cars will be sold on a first-come, first-serve basis.&#160;</p><p>The i3s were part of Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti's push to go greener.&#160;Despite the good intentions, things didn't go according to plan.</p><p>The cars didn't wind up doing much of the outreach they were intended for, a <a href=\"https://losangeles.cbslocal.com/2018/01/16/goldstein-investigation-10-million-lapd-electric-bmws-appear-unused-misused/\">CBS Los Angeles investigation</a> from January 2018 found. Instead, they sat, rarely used. If they were used, CBS Los Angeles said they were used for non-police business, such as visiting nail salons and picking folks up for lunch.&#160;</p><p>CBS Los Angeles <a href=\"https://jalopnik.com/that-fleet-of-electric-cars-the-lapd-paid-at-least-2-9-1822197230\">later clarified</a> that, according to numbers it obtained from the LAPD, the entire cost of the i3 and charging-station operation cost $10.2 million, with plans for 300 cars in the fleet.</p><p>In an emailed response to Business Insider, an LAPD spokesperson said the department is not selling the i3s. Rather, they said the cars' leases had expired and that's why they're being resold by the leasing company.</p><p>\"The 50 vehicles were turned in by us at the end of the leasing period per the contract,\" the spokesperson said.</p><p>So if you're in the Southern California region and you're looking for a cheap EV, keep your eyes on New Century BMW's inventory list. Once that new shipment comes in, it'll probably go fast.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/lapd-selling-fleet-bmw-i3-cheap-ev-electric-vehicle-california-2020-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a Lee)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f5297bae6ff30001d4e73c1?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn38@2020_4/2020/09/06/02-59-54-327_c3a253959fb1e32b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f5297bb7ed0ee001e25da54?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn29@2020_4/2020/09/06/02-59-56-798_aaee954f874339a4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn78@2020_1/2020/09/06/02-59-58-308_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=msjK1YYD0lI:aHH7xCD4Zdc:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn93@2020_3/2020/09/06/02-59-55-552_d867a8519b94d1af.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=msjK1YYD0lI:aHH7xCD4Zdc:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn26@2020_4/2020/09/06/02-59-54-977_80fed14b7baba948.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn60@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-52-353_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=msjK1YYD0lI:aHH7xCD4Zdc:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn37@2020_4/2020/09/06/02-59-59-838_acfe5122f762bdbf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/msjK1YYD0lI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn55@2020_2/2020/09/06/02-59-44-250_87b8d5471c494450.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599361164654},{"createdTime":"2020-09-06 10:59:24","updatedTime":"2020-09-06 10:59:24","title":"Kentucky GOP Rep. Thomas Massie defended accused Kenosha killer Kyle Rittenhouse and said he showed 'incredible restraint' in shooting 3 people","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/massie-defended-rittenhouse-showed-great-restraint-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f53aa77e6ff30001d4e74d6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"thomas massie\" height=\"512\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rep. Thomas Massie at a news conference on Wednesday, Dec. 9, 2015, outside of the Capitol.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/rep-thomas-massie-r-ky-and-rep-walter-jones-r-n-c-hold-a-news-photo/500585134?adppopup=true\" target=\"_blank\">Bill Clark/CQ Roll Call</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Rep. Thomas Massie, a Republican from Kentucky, defended accused Kenosha killer Kyle Rittenhouse in a radio interview earlier this week.</li>\n<li>Police say Rittenhouse, 17, shot three people during an August protest in Kenosha, Wisconsin, killing two.</li>\n<li>Local authorities charged Rittenhouse with first-degree intentional homicide, first-degree reckless homicide, and a misdemeanor charge of possession of a deadly weapon following the August 25 shooting.</li>\n<li>\"I would not convict him of a single one of these charges,\" Massie said Thursday.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Republican Rep. Thomas Massie of Kentucky in an interview Thursday defended Kyle Rittenhouse, the 17-year-old accused of shooting three people and killing two of them, during an anti-racism protest in Kenosha, Wisconsin, in August.</p><p>\"He also exhibited incredible restraint and presence and situational awareness,\" Massie <a href=\"https://www.iheart.com/podcast/512-tom-roten-morning-show-28270078/\">said in a radio interview with WVHU</a>. \"He didn't empty a magazine into a crowd. There were people around him who could have caused him harm, but as soon as they showed any sign of retreat or nonaggression, he did not shoot them. He exhibited more restraint than a lot of the police videos I've seen.\"</p><p>Local authorities charged Rittenhouse with first-degree intentional homicide, first-degree reckless homicide, and a misdemeanor charge of possession of a deadly weapon following the August 25 shooting. Rittenhouse, <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/kyle-rittenhouse-who-shot-kenosha-protesters-was-obsessed-with-cops-2020-8\">who previously attended a rally for the president and expressed support for Blue Lives Matter</a>, reportedly shot the first victim after the man threw a plastic bag at him, according to <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/rittenhouse-killed-protester-after-they-threw-plastic-bag-prosecutors-2020-8#:~:text=Suspect%20in%20Kenosha%20shooting%2C%20Kyle,at%20him%2C%20criminal%20complaint%20says&text=A%20ghost.&text=Kyle%20Rittenhouse%2C%20the%20teen%20accused,charged%20by%20prosecutors%20on%20Thursday.hursday.\">the criminal complaint filed against the 17-year-old</a>.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f539ad6e6ff30001d4e74c4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"kyle rittenhouse tik tok\" height=\"367\" width=\"735\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Kyle Rittenhouse, 17, was charged with first-degree intentional homicide after killing two protesters in Kenshoa, Wisconsin.\n<p class=\"copyright\">TikTok</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Following the first shooting, <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/kyle-rittenhouse-who-shot-kenosha-protesters-was-obsessed-with-cops-2020-8?utm_campaign=sf-bi-main&utm_medium=social&utm_source=facebook.com&fbclid=IwAR2i45k2Bnj_AP375z7E-M3GRvc7x3iZLSgWd3WMos2RjLmgMWAHsu_3yz4gMWAHsu_3yz4\">video of the incident shows a crowd chased a person believed to be Rittenhouse</a> before an ensuing struggle that ended when Rittenhouse fired his semiautomatic weapon at two people in close range, fatally wounding one of them.</p><p>Rittenhouse wouldn't be arrested until the following day.</p><p>\"He was fulfilling his obligation to retreat, and then he fell down, and these, one tried to attack him with a skateboard, another pulled a handgun on him, another tried to jump on him with his foot, and he responded in self-defense,\" Massie said in the interview with radio host Tom Roten.</p><p>\"I would not convict him of a single one of these charges,\" Massie added.</p><p>As Insider previously noted, Rittenhouse told the conservative outlet The Daily Caller he traveled to Kenosha from Illinois to protect businesses amid chaotic anti-racism demonstrations in the city that occurred following the police shooting of 29-year-old <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/category/jacob-blake\">Jacob Blake</a> in the city.</p><p>Massie also said Thursday that he was \"not as aware of that situation\" of Blake as he was as Rittenhouse, who was shot multiple times by police in the back on August 23, which sparked the events in Kenosha that lead up to the shootings two days later.</p><p>\"It needs to be reviewed, everybody gets a trial,\" Massie said of the police shooting of Blake.</p><p>When asked about Rittenhouse and the president's refusal to condemn the actions of his supporters, like Rittenhouse, in an interview earlier this week, White House chief of staff Mark Meadows said <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-law-enforcement-and-the-rule-of-law-2020-8\">Trump was \"on the side of law enforcement and the rule of law</a>.\" On Monday, the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-defends-kyle-rittenhouse-charged-with-homicide-in-kenosha-2020-8\">president defended Rittenhouse at a press conference</a>.</p><p>As Insider's Kelly McLaughlin noted, <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/kenosha-suspect-kyle-rittenhouse-right-wing-symbol-2020-9\">experts have said the president's refusal to condemn the accused Kenosha killer could ratchet up tensions</a>, as the right continues to view Rittenhouse as a symbol for their cause in favor of gun rights and against the anti-racism protests.</p><p>\"That was an interesting situation,\" Trump said on Monday. \"He was trying to get away from them, I guess, it looks like, and he fell, and then they very violently attacked him.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/massie-defended-rittenhouse-showed-great-restraint-2020-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=BEyidO7jHcc:mYsDmWXeS3M:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=BEyidO7jHcc:mYsDmWXeS3M:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=BEyidO7jHcc:mYsDmWXeS3M:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=BEyidO7jHcc:mYsDmWXeS3M:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/BEyidO7jHcc\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 05 Sep 2020 15:01:05 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f53aa687ed0ee001e25db83?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"a0c48e20ad917a33cd99347b128de3df","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn52@2020_3/2020/09/06/02-59-44-332_a344a32033696e79.webp","destWidth":911,"destHeight":682,"sourceBytes":39844,"destBytes":39844,"author":"insider@insider.com (Connor Perrett)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f53aa77e6ff30001d4e74d6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn54@2020_1/2020/09/06/02-59-59-947_feca0ab2369b698a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f539ad6e6ff30001d4e74c4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn21@2020_5/2020/09/06/02-59-54-999_0eb509e732a68228.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn78@2020_1/2020/09/06/02-59-58-308_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=BEyidO7jHcc:mYsDmWXeS3M:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn8@2020_2/2020/09/06/02-59-47-092_705d268aef1eab23.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=BEyidO7jHcc:mYsDmWXeS3M:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn80@2020_1/2020/09/06/02-59-51-715_f13df16a62cff2f2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn60@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-52-353_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=BEyidO7jHcc:mYsDmWXeS3M:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn59@2020_5/2020/09/06/02-59-59-858_46f7e878f26a848b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/BEyidO7jHcc":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn30@2020_2/2020/09/06/02-59-58-754_8fcf68a8a8a25471.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599361164630},{"createdTime":"2020-09-06 10:59:24","updatedTime":"2020-09-06 10:59:24","title":"Everything you should know about tequila and 13 great tequila brands to try, according to experts","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-tequila-brands-to-try-according-to-experts-mexico","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eac70ae5f726e24686ad438?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cucumber Mint Margarita from Bodega Taqueria y Tequila\" height=\"1504\" width=\"2005\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The best tequilas can add different flavors to your margaritas.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bodega Taqueria y Tequila</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Any weekend is a great weekend to open up a new bottle of tequila, whether you're mixing margaritas or tasting it straight.&#160;</li>\n<li>These tequila experts explain what makes a good bottle &#8212; and all the different types for various occasions, including Blanco, Reposado, Anejo, and Extra Anejo.</li>\n<li>Pure tequila must be produced from the Blue Agave plant that has matured for a minimum of six years and be 100% agave; cheap tequila is often only 50%.</li>\n<li>Their top 13 picks are straight from regions in Mexico where tequila hails from, including Calle 23 and Arette tequila from Jalisco.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>As a travel journalist with an expertise in Mexico, I usually spend half the year living south of the border — except, of course, for this particular year amid the pandemic. So instead of sampling tequila in its birthplace, I reached out to top tequila experts in Mexico and beyond to unearth their favorites.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tBut first, let's dispel a few tequila misconceptions.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb04af4204ad30429090526?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tequila expert Iliana Partida\" height=\"3000\" width=\"4000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Iliana Partida, tequila expert.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Iliana Partida</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>More often than not, we associate the word \"tequila\" with bad decisions followed by painful mornings. Well, it might surprise you know that the tequila of your past was, simply put, not tequila. And until you've had the real deal, you don't know what you're missing.&#160;</p><p>\"Great tequila starts with great agave,\" tequila expert Iliana Partida told Business Insider. Agave is the raw material for tequila. \"First, you want to make sure that your tequila is 100% de agave, which means that all of the alcohol in the tequila is distilled from the agave plant.\" Partida is a fourth generation master distiller at Tres Agaves, based in Jalisco, Mexico.&#160;</p><p>What you drank in college was definitely not 100% de agave. That tequila, called mixto, can have as little at 51% of alcohol coming from agave. The other 49% comes from other alcohols &#8212; and usually the cheap stuff &#8212; which is why you may not have fond memories of drinking it.</p>\n\tBut it can't be just any agave.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb04b76e3c3fb072e028ae5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Juan Bonilla, CEO of Juan Bonilla Imports\" height=\"3648\" width=\"4864\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Juan Bonilla, tequila expert\n<p class=\"copyright\">Juan Bonilla</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>In order for it to be pure tequila, it must be produced from the Blue Agave plant, and a plant that has matured for a minimum of six years. \"The optimum maturing time is nine years, but still the best tequilas are made with agaves that are at least six years in the ground,\" said Juan Bonilla, CEO of Juan Bonilla Imports, an Atlanta-based company dedicated to importing and distributing tequila. Bonilla grew up with tequila in his blood. His family has owned agave farms for generations in Mexico.</p><p>Similar to Champagne, tequila can only truly be called \"tequila\" when it comes from one of the five designated states in Mexico that have the government designation to make and produce it. The most well-known tequila state is Jalisco, which is where tequila was born.&#160;</p><p>After harvesting, the agave undergoes a distilling process and then is aged in barrels, steel or oak, to produce its four different types: Blanco, Reposado, Anejo, and Extra Anejo. Blanco tequila is the youngest tequila, meaning that it is aged for less than 60 days. Sometimes it is bottled immediately after distillation. Reposado tequila is typically aged from 60 days to one year. Anejo, which means \"vintage,\" is aged from one to three years, while Extra Anejo is aged four years.</p>\n\tAs for tasting tequila, the experience is quite similar to a wine or whiskey tasting.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/55588eeaeab8eaa32fc4f734?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tequila\" height=\"2332\" width=\"3110\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Shots are not the proper way to taste tequila.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>There is a \"proper\" way &#8212; and no, it's not in a shot. Tequilas are always best when sipped, usually neat, to get the raw flavors of the spirit. \"Tequila is known to have 600 different aromas,\" said Javier Moreno Gomez, Tequila &#38; Wine Sommelier at Grand Residences Riviera Cancun, a luxury resort in Cancun. \"Some of them include citrus, mint, floral, honey, oak, almond, vanilla, butterscotch, chocolate, among others.\" The basic tasting method for tequila is: swirl, sniff, sip, swallow.</p><p>So now, without further ado <strong>and in no particular order</strong>, here are 13 of the best tequila brands out there, according to our experts.</p>\n\t1. Don Nacho\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb04c8fe3c3fb07cc393903?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Don Nacho tequila Añejo\" height=\"3000\" width=\"4000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Añejo.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tequila Don Nacho</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The family that produces the <a href=\"https://go.redirectingat.com/?id=35871X943606&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fdrizly.com%2Fliquor-brands%2Fdon-nacho%2Fb3033\" rel=\"nofollow sponsored\">Don Nacho</a> tequilas have been harvesting agaves for more than two generations. They are one the largest producers of agave in Mexico. \"[The family] gives agaves to a lot of other tequila companies, but they harvest the best for their own,\" said Bonilla. \"[Don Nacho] is 100% de agave with no additives. The taste is superb.\"</p><p>Don Nacho has two lines of tequila: Premiere and Extra Premiere. The Premiere has Blanco and Reposado, while the Extra Premiere has Blanco, Reposado, and Anejo. This year they will add an Extra Anejo to their Extra Premiere line.</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\t2. La Cava de Don Samuel\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb0617c204ad310b055bd19?format=jpeg\" alt=\"La Cava de Don Samuel tequila\" height=\"730\" width=\"974\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>La Cava de Don Samuel Reposado tequila.\n<p class=\"copyright\">La Cava de Don Samuel</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>From the small highland town of Atotonilco in Jalisco comes this extraordinary line of tequila.&#160;</p><p>\"Don Samuel was one of the biggest commercial entrepreneurs in the town,\" said Bonilla. \"In 2007 he created a special production of around 10,000 bottles of Reposado tequila. This reserve is so unique, and there are not that many on the market. It must be tried.\"</p>\n\t3. Don Fernando\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb04d96cdfd48024460e2b3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Don Fernando blanco tequila\" height=\"702\" width=\"936\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tequila blanco.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Don Fernando Facebook</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Don Fernando tequila is grown and produced in the lowlands of Jalisco, which gives it a dry flavor. \"This gives it a very subtle taste,\" said Bonilla. \"The location brings a lot of natural spring water into the mix, which is just amazing.\"</p><p>Don Fernando has a regular line of tequila, which produces Reposado and Blanco. They also have a premium line, which includes Anejo and Extra Anejo.</p>\n\t4. Tres Agaves Anejo\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb04e0348d92c0c347fbbe5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tres Agaves Anejo tequila\" height=\"1332\" width=\"1776\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tres Agaves Anejo.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dustin Smith</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>\"I always sip Anejo with some chocolates, berries, or nuts around to snack on when I do &#8212; maybe some water, too, so I don't dehydrate myself,\" said Partida. \"I just love the combination of flavors &#8212; the caramel and vanilla from the Anejo with the sweet and bitter combinations of the snacks.\"</p>\n\t5. Fortaleza Blanco\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb04e82204ad3066e580559?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fortaleza blanco tequila\" height=\"4800\" width=\"3200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Fortaleza Blanco.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tequila Fortaleza</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>\"A tried and true brand, the brand's commitment to heritage shows itself in the consistently pungent agave flavor that is good enough to enjoy neat, and powerful enough to stand out in cocktails,\" said tequila expert, Tess Lampert. Lampert is a New York-based educator and writer about agave spirits. She consults with top tequila brands and restaurants and organizes events across the nation to educate consumers, trade, and media on all aspects of agave.</p>\n\t6. Arette Blanco\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb062a3fc593d09ef549472?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Arette Blanco tequila\" height=\"1286\" width=\"948\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Arette Blanco.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tequila Arette</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>\"A lot of folks have gone down the path of considering <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=2025&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wine.com%2Fproduct%2Farette-artesanal-blanco-tequila%2F528374%3F\" rel=\"nofollow sponsored\">Blanco tequilas</a> the best for 'shots.' I prefer sipping them from a Reidel glass to elevate the experience, and really enjoy the complexities and nuances of the agave characteristics,\" said Yuseff Cherney, founder and master distiller at Cutwater Spirits. He has been distilling spirits for 10 years and his distillery has a partnership with a family-owned distillery in Jalisco.</p>\n\t7. Siembra Valles Anejo\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb077e73dac9a1ee53e2574?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Siembra Valles\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Siembra Valles Facebook</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Full-bodied and caramel in color, <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=2025&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wine.com%2Fproduct%2Fsiembra-valles-anejo-tequila%2F540882%3F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Siembra Valles Anejo</a> has scents of agave, nuts, spices, and vanilla. Lampert said, \"This tequila comes from one of the few producers that expertly ages tequila for a final product that is smooth and full of barrel complexity, without losing the agave core.\"</p>\n\t8. Siete Leguas Reposado\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb0502948d92c0d7179619c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Siete Leguas Reposado tequila\" height=\"1159\" width=\"1545\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Reposado.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tequila Siete Leguas Facebook</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Excellent for both sipping and mixing, <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=2025&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wine.com%2Fproduct%2Fsiete-leguas-reposado-tequila%2F530807%3F\" rel=\"nofollow sponsored\">Siete Leguas Reposado</a> is an absolute pleasure. \"This is a magical tequila,\" said Lampert. \"I have been including it in guided tastings for years and it is always a crowd favorite. It is so well-balanced with powerful agave flavors, while integrating the soft wood notes.\"</p>\n\t9. Calle 23 Blanco\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb061f1578532115346aece?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Calle 23 Blanco tequila\" height=\"4928\" width=\"3289\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Calle 23 Blanco.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Calle 23</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The product is from French biochemist Sophie Decobecq (one of the few female tequila producers in the industry). Her tequila, <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=2025&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wine.com%2Fproduct%2Fcalle-23-blanco-tequila%2F540938%3F\" rel=\"nofollow sponsored\">Calle 23</a>, is produced in Los Altos, Jalisco.</p><p>\"I particularly tend to stay with Blanco tequilas nowadays, not to say other expressions aren't worth trying, I just like the taste of the raw mineral in this case,\" said Ignacio \"Nacho\" Jimenez, one of the most acclaimed bartenders in the country. Originally from Mexico, he leads the bar program at Ghost Donkey in New York, which was named Imbibe magazine's cocktail bar of 2020. \"Her Blanco has a nice velvet palate complemented by nice earthy and herbaceous notes.\"</p>\n\t10. Milagro Select Barrel Reserve Anejo\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb05912204ad30b601cf132?format=jpeg\" alt=\"SBR Interim bottle_Anejo milagro tequila\" height=\"7500\" width=\"5358\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Select Barrel Reserve Anejo.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Milagro Tequila</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>From the highlands of Jalisco comes this premium line of tequila, from 100% estate-grown agaves.&#160;</p><p>\"By law all tequila must be distilled twice, however a select few choose to distill a third time, like this one,\" said Jimenez. \"This expression is aged three years in French white oak barrels that have been heavily roasted. The result is a rich amber color tequila with some soft and well-integrated oak on the nose, and on the palate cinnamon spice and white pepper.\"</p>\n\t11. Tequila Mi Tierra\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ef616f85af6cc6c045b97a6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"mi tierra silver 1\" height=\"720\" width=\"390\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tequila Mi Tierra tequila.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tequila Mi Tierra</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Tequila Mi Tierra is a very small, boutique producer. The extra attention and focus allows them to be exceptional across the board from their blanco to their extra anejo.<br /><br />\"The water in the region [in Jalisco] gives a unique touch,\" said Bonilla. \"The natural flavors from the soil can be detected giving a peppery sensation. There is a great finish and aroma. Both the reposado, the anejo, and the extra anejo have an outstanding nose.\"<br /><br />Bonilla recommends all for sipping, but says that both the blanco and reposado can be used for mixing. The anejo and extra anejo should be sipped, for sure.</p>\n\t12. Santera Tequila\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4957c07ffa48002894cf23?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Santera Tequila\" height=\"2277\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Santera Tequila.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Santera Tequila</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Hailing from Jalisco, <a href=\"https://santeratequila.com/\">Santera Tequila</a> is born from the soil of the now-sleeping Volcan de Tequila in the northern highlands. While the last eruption was more than 22,000 years ago, the volcano's red soil fosters beautiful blue agave today, and it's from these agaves that Santera is born.&#160;</p><p>The Santera Reposado is aged in American oak up to seven months and has hints of that oaky flavor, along with touches of cinnamon. The Anejo is aged up to 16 months and threads in notes of leather and tobacco.</p><p>\"Santera is an excellent example of brick oven-roasted agave being used to craft a tequila,\" said Freddie Sarkis, chief cocktail officer at Liquor Lab in New York City. \"It is elegant with a peppery finish.\"</p><p>He recommends Santera for sipping, but the Blanco is also bright and citrusy when mixed in cocktails.</p>\n\t13. Coça Pura Plata\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52813f7ed0ee001e25d9b9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"COCA PURA BOTTLE SHOT CLOSE UP\" height=\"1313\" width=\"1033\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Coca Pura.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Coca Pura</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Blanco tequilas have the reputation for being harsh on the palate, but this doesn't necessarily have to be the reality. There are plenty of fantastic Blanco tequilas that are delicious and smooth as sipping tequilas. For Anthony Baker, cocktail professor at Momentum Mixology, <a href=\"https://cocapura.com/\">Co&#231;a Pura Plata</a> is one to know.</p><p>\"It is a blanco tequila with a higher-than-normal ABV &#8212; 90 proof &#8212; yet extremely smooth,\" he said. \"These qualities make it perfect for boozy tequila cocktails, and even good enough to just sip.</p><p>Baker said the reason behind the smoothness is due to the aging process. The tequila is aged in a barrel for just under two months, which means it's just as smooth as a Reposado, but can still legally be called a Blanco.</p><p>\"In fact, it's so lovely and smooth, I've used it in an espresso martini-esque cocktail, and it came out absolutely perfect. These types of cocktails typically call for vodka, but I needed something clean with a fuller body to it.\"</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Drillinger)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5eac70ae5f726e24686ad438?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn95@2020_5/2020/09/06/02-59-45-259_c4c981418e7ee1ab.webp","https://i.insider.com/5eb04af4204ad30429090526?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn32@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-52-219_54f22623a1e76abc.webp","https://i.insider.com/5eb04b76e3c3fb072e028ae5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn78@2020_5/2020/09/06/02-59-55-402_2c7e8eaaca6b667a.webp","https://i.insider.com/55588eeaeab8eaa32fc4f734?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn76@2020_3/2020/09/06/02-59-51-714_e7dc8a6c647d962c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5eb04c8fe3c3fb07cc393903?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn74@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-58-440_937d1caeb0aa0aa8.webp","https://i.insider.com/5eb0617c204ad310b055bd19?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn20@2020_4/2020/09/06/02-59-48-243_c78b13e93e916fe7.webp","https://i.insider.com/5eb04d96cdfd48024460e2b3?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn20@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-54-007_889e08e750e91d27.webp","https://i.insider.com/5eb04e0348d92c0c347fbbe5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn6@2020_1/2020/09/06/02-59-55-749_20d7fc838a6fbc1b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5eb04e82204ad3066e580559?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn42@2020_2/2020/09/06/02-59-55-185_9fc64a360429773a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5eb062a3fc593d09ef549472?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn56@2020_5/2020/09/06/02-59-47-590_5e7072d23f8bf638.webp","https://i.insider.com/5eb077e73dac9a1ee53e2574?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn28@2020_2/2020/09/06/02-59-47-349_4b21ca80baa627bf.webp","https://i.insider.com/5eb0502948d92c0d7179619c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn8@2020_1/2020/09/06/02-59-24-942_1630f2efd03e6b2a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5eb061f1578532115346aece?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn41@2020_4/2020/09/06/02-59-58-103_bc4bfb29cf8bbe17.webp","https://i.insider.com/5eb05912204ad30b601cf132?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn51@2020_5/2020/09/06/02-59-48-559_0b21961c8367862b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ef616f85af6cc6c045b97a6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn31@2020_3/2020/09/06/02-59-48-491_1029d167151a0a26.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f4957c07ffa48002894cf23?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn38@2020_2/2020/09/06/02-59-55-608_b4fc7d67ac845444.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f52813f7ed0ee001e25d9b9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn4@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-46-942_0aa2f738988a6979.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn78@2020_1/2020/09/06/02-59-58-308_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=TlXc-lIxg4Q:rrKLCWyDd5g:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn34@2020_4/2020/09/06/02-59-58-938_53b8c1ac0f08ed6a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=TlXc-lIxg4Q:rrKLCWyDd5g:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn49@2020_3/2020/09/06/02-59-54-175_e617c3065b651544.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn60@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-52-353_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=TlXc-lIxg4Q:rrKLCWyDd5g:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn1@2020_2/2020/09/06/02-59-59-564_267806996286f263.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/TlXc-lIxg4Q":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn4@2020_4/2020/09/06/02-59-45-198_2b6dfaacd9aac54c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599361164630},{"createdTime":"2020-09-06 10:59:24","updatedTime":"2020-09-06 10:59:24","title":"You can be both social and safe during the pandemic","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/science-safe-social-covid-19-pandemic-shaming-outdoor-virus-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f527ee2e6ff30001d4e731f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"dining outdoors\" height=\"460\" width=\"921\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">ALEX EDELMAN/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Politics have largely influenced responses to the pandemic.</li>\n<li>Science shows there are safe and responsible ways to enjoy outdoor dining and other social activities.</li>\n<li>Until a proper treatment arrives, we have to find reasonable ways to live while also reducing harm to others.</li>\n<li>Noah Friedman is a writer and producer based in New York.</li>\n<li>This is an opinion column. The thoughts expressed are those of the author.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Thinking about grabbing a beer at a bar soon? There's a hidden risk to consider, and it's not a virus.</p><p>If you post about your outing, <a href=\"https://www.eater.com/21409384/dining-out-shame-keeps-restaurant-patrons-off-instagram-during-the-pandemic\">prepare to face judgment</a> from friends, followers, or some random person across the country. No, it doesn't matter if you're following all recommended safety measures. To some, there's simply no ethical way to go out to a restaurant, and they've found comfort in isolation and misery, holding it as proof that they're getting through the pandemic \"the right way.\"</p><p>To be fair, there's a lot to be miserable about living in America during Covid-19. Over <a href=\"https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fcoronavirus%2F2019-ncov%2Fcases-updates%2Fcases-in-us.html#cases\">180,000 people dead</a>, dwindling and insufficient economic support, and dithering leadership at the highest levels. This has made for little clarity on best practices for reducing the spread of the virus. People have been left to make their own calls on how to behave responsibly.</p><p>Social pressure can be a useful tool in keeping everyone on track, especially given the void in leadership. Seeing everyone else wear their masks can be the reminder that you need to throw yours on. But it can also go too far, when it becomes less about promoting rational behavior and more about signaling who's handling the crisis better than others.&#160;</p><h2>The partisan pandemic</h2><p>As with everything else, the response to the pandemic is largely divided on political lines. The right wants to largely ignore the outbreak, quickly rallying against mask protocols and pushing to reopen the economy as soon as possible. In April, Texas Lt. Gov. Dan Patrick said \"<a href=\"https://www.texastribune.org/2020/04/21/texas-dan-patrick-economy-coronavirus/\">there are more important things than living</a>\" while praising the state's moves towards re-opening, tacitly offering up his life for the economic future of the country. President Trump <a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1241935285916782593\">tweeted</a>: \"WE CANNOT LET THE CURE BE WORSE THAN THE PROBLEM ITSELF.\" The protests of masks and closures align with basic reactionary ideological lines, dismissing science to \"own the libs\" and prove a point.</p><p>Meanwhile, the left adopted a cautious approach while questions swirled about what measures are actually effective. Are masks harmful or helpful? Can we jog outside? What about surface contact? Many chose to stay locked up inside alone, minimizing outside contact and lowering the risk of infection. All alone in isolation with nowhere to go, there was now plenty of time to worry about other people's behavior and whether it matched your own standards. Additionally, the right's brash ignorance led to a lack of nuance when it came to a serious conversation about a responsible return to society.</p><p>Contrary to much of the left's outcries,there <em>are</em> areas where reopening seems possible, namely New York City, which of course suffered one of the worst outbreaks in the world. Cases are now down to less than <a href=\"https://www1.nyc.gov/site/doh/covid/covid-19-data.page\">300 a day</a>, compared to over 5,000 daily in April. The<a href=\"https://twitter.com/NYGovCuomo/status/1300094116735447040?s=20\"> infection rate is under 1%</a>. So what's working for New York? Masks are worn indoors, testing is widely available, and restaurants and bars have appropriately-distanced outdoor seating.</p><p>And yet, social media posts showing socially-distanced, rule-following public outings are often met with digital finger-wagging, deeming anyone not holed up in their apartment as selfish, uncompassionate, and irresponsible.&#160;</p><p>Even worse are well-intentioned but <a href=\"https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/v74az9/the-viral-study-about-runners-spreading-coronavirus-is-not-actually-a-study\">misleading studies</a> on the spread of the virus. Everyone has become a keyboard epidemiologist since March, and these comments only heighten anxiety. I suspect it's rooted in a desire for some agency in a time when we seemingly have none.</p><p>While the right dismissed facts as a sign of loyalty to the president, the other side is also overlooking science to signal a moral superiority, shaming those who are choosing to venture out of complete solitude while still behaving safely.&#160;</p><p>So, let's look at the facts of the situation: the odds of indoor transmission are <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/jvchamary/2020/06/30/face-mask-outdoors-coronavirus/#725ffcc81822\">18.7 times greater </a>than in open air. A <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/15/us/coronavirus-what-to-do-outside.html\">study of 7,300 cases</a> in China found just one was connected to outdoor transmission. Research suggests that the likelihood of <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/28/well/live/whats-the-risk-of-catching-coronavirus-from-a-surface.html\">surface transmission </a>has been <a href=\"https://www.thelancet.com/pdfs/journals/laninf/PIIS1473-3099(20)30561-2.pdf\">exaggerated</a> and is actually quite unlikely. Washing your hands regularly and avoiding touching your face should do the trick. Reducing your social circle to a smaller \"quarantine pod\" has also been <a href=\"https://www.pbs.org/newshour/health/quarantine-bubbles-when-done-right-limit-coronavirus-risk-and-help-fight-loneliness\">shown to be rather effective.</a>&#160;</p><h2>Outside looking in</h2><p>The restaurant industry is among those hardest hit by the pandemic. While <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/23/nyregion/outdoor-dining-new-york.html\">over 10,000 restaurants in NYC </a>have set up outdoor seating and increased takeout, they are still serving only a fraction of their regular number of customers. The federal paycheck protection program simply won't be enough to keep these restaurants above water, especially once outdoor seating is no longer an option during the winter. Without a more substantial bailout of the industry, the only way these restaurants and bars have any chance of survival is if they're patronized.&#160;</p><p>My biggest question for people quick to judge others for going out is: what are you waiting for? While there have been positive updates on a vaccine, it still could be years away, if we're lucky enough to ever have one. In the meantime, in places with deflating case numbers, we must find a manageable way to live.</p><p>The cost of the pandemic isn't just Covid-19 cases and financial burdens; there's also a mental toll. <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/05/opinion/coronavirus-mental-illness-depression.html\">More than 1 in 3 Americans reported symptoms of an anxiety disorder this year, compared to 1 in 12 last year, and over 53% believe the pandemic has taken a toll on their mental health.</a> Seeing friends can help ease the existential dread surrounding us, and if one can do so safely and without endangering others, why shouldn't they?</p><p>Naturally, ignoring all safety protocols is more dangerous than being overly cautious, but snidely commenting on Instagram posts won't cure the virus either. There's no prize for who can be the loneliest person, and ignorance can swing both ways. Don't let the reactionary right push you into a paranoid furor, and likewise, don't shame those who are safely trying to make it through this. It doesn't mean we're \"over it,\" just that we need to adapt based on the current situation. Like it or not, we're all in this together.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/science-safe-social-covid-19-pandemic-shaming-outdoor-virus-2020-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a
