(Noah Friedman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f527ee2e6ff30001d4e731f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn13@2020_4/2020/09/06/02-59-55-661_fec53e99ab69b339.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn78@2020_1/2020/09/06/02-59-58-308_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=izQIQtor6Po:wbUhPOlJhFY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn19@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-56-701_2e212b7ac56598c0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=izQIQtor6Po:wbUhPOlJhFY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn28@2020_4/2020/09/06/02-59-50-171_d685b46031a90576.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn60@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-52-353_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=izQIQtor6Po:wbUhPOlJhFY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn90@2020_5/2020/09/06/02-59-58-579_3b027cfcf39df5a5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/izQIQtor6Po":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn22@2020_4/2020/09/06/02-59-58-660_5896838175cdf76e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599361164661},{"createdTime":"2020-09-06 10:59:24","updatedTime":"2020-09-06 10:59:24","title":"Photos from 10 countries around the world show why most Americans say they are 'embarrassed' by the US coronavirus response","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/photos-us-has-the-worst-coronavirus-response-in-the-world-2020-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec261e6ff30001d4e680c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"new zealand and china under control \" height=\"600\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Infection rates in China and New Zealand are so low that people can get cheek-to-cheek without risking much. The same can&#39;t be said in the US.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Countries like China and New Zealand have learned how to dance effectively with the coronavirus, minimizing and controlling their outbreaks.</li>\n<li>But the US has not, and still carries the unenviable distinction of tallying the most confirmed coronavirus cases of any country, and the most deaths.&#160;</li>\n<li>Here's a glimpse into 9 other countries around the globe that are dealing with the pandemic far better than America is right now.</li>\n<li>They include New Zealand, China, Senegal, Ghana, Spain, France, Mexico, India, and South Korea.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>&#160;</p><p>No place on Earth has logged more coronavirus infections or more deaths than the United States.</p><p>In China — where the outbreak began — people are gathering without masks, because the risk of catching COVID-19 (the disease caused by the virus) is so low.</p><p>In India, where cases are spiking, the government is rushing out mobile testing centers — no bigger than a food truck — which deliver results to residents for free, in minutes.</p><p>Most Americans, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/7-in-10-americans-embarrassed-us-coronavirus-response-cnn-poll-2020-8\">when asked</a>, say their country's response to the virus makes them feel \"embarrassed\" and an overwhelming majority are angry, expressing frustration that more isn't being done to fight the pandemic on their shores, according to a <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/19/politics/cnn-poll-us-coronavirus-response-embarrassed/index.html\">recent CNN poll</a>.&#160;</p><p>Here's a glimpse at how nine other countries are more effectively tackling the virus's global spread, and how America stacks up:&#160;</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tIn Wuhan, China, more than 1 million children went back to school this week.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec10f7ed0ee001e25cde0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"china first day of school 2020 wuhan\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Students listen to a speech by a doctor in a ceremony kicking off the new semester in Wuhan, China, Tuesday, September 1, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Feature China/Barcroft Media via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>2,842 kindergartens, primary, and secondary schools reopened on Tuesday, September 1 in the city where the coronavirus outbreak began, China's state news agency reported.&#160;</p>\n\tThere are no confirmed coronavirus cases in the city of Wuhan, or surrounding area, so the kids don't always need to wear masks.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5134c87ed0ee001e25d52b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"wuhan high school\" height=\"1424\" width=\"2100\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Students take part in the opening ceremony of a new semester at Wuhan High School in Wuhan, capital of central China&#39;s Hubei Province, September 1, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Xiao Yijiu/Xinhua via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>According <a href=\"https://ncov.dxy.cn/ncovh5/view/pneumonia?from=dxy&#38;source=&#38;link=&#38;share=\">to DXY</a>, an <a href=\"https://www.thelancet.com/journals/laninf/article/PIIS1473-3099(20)30120-1/fulltext\">online tool run</a> by people in the Chinese medical community, there are currently no confirmed coronavirus infections in the entire Hubei province, where Wuhan is located.</p><p><a href=\"http://en.nhc.gov.cn/2020-09/04/c_81555.htm\">Chinese state media reported</a> the last confirmed case of the virus in the region was released from the hospital on August 31.&#160;</p>\n\tBack in the US, hundreds of students have already contracted the virus, after returning to class mask-free.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f32c446f0f419391401c16d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"North Paulding High School\" height=\"675\" width=\"900\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A photo showing a packed hallway at North Paulding High School in Dallas, Georgia, on August 3, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hannah Watters/Twitter</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Several schools in US states including <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/georgia-school-district-closes-second-high-school-over-covid-outbreak-2020-8\">Georgia</a>, Tennessee, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/photos-show-school-reopenings-coronavirus-outbreaks-2020-8\">and Indiana that reopened</a> for classes in recent weeks have had to shutter once again, after battling major virus outbreaks.&#160;</p><p>There are at least <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-colleges-universities-with-the-most-coronavirus-cases-2020-9\">70 other, major outbreaks of the coronavirus</a>&#160;on college and university campuses nationwide.&#160;</p>\n\tOnly a few dozen new cases of the virus are being diagnosed nationwide in China every day.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec10ce6ff30001d4e6802?format=jpeg\" alt=\"china beer festival \" height=\"1464\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Residents and tourists drink beer on the first weekend after the opening of the 30th Qingdao International Beer Festival in Shandong Province, China, August 1, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Costfoto/Barcroft Media via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The <a href=\"https://covid19.who.int/table\">World Health Organization</a> said there are \"clusters\" of cases being diagnosed in the country, as opposed to the widespread community transmission in the US.&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tMany of the cases being diagnosed in China now are imported by travelers from abroad.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec10c7ed0ee001e25cddc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"china night market 2020\" height=\"1466\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Women wearing traditional clothing posing for photos as they visit a night market in Wuhan, China on August 27, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">STR/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>There were <a href=\"https://covid19.who.int/table\">33 new confirmed cases of the virus reported</a> in China in the past 24 hours, according to the WHO on Friday.&#160;<a href=\"http://en.nhc.gov.cn/2020-09/04/c_81554.htm\">Shanghai reported five new cases of the virus</a> imported there Friday, all Chinese nationals traveling home from studying or working abroad.</p><p>Since March, China has chiefly only opened its borders to allow Chinese people traveling home to return, even making it difficult for <a href=\"https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/wjbxw/t1761867.shtml\">foreign nationals living in China to re-enter the country</a>. China also enforced strict quarantining measures on anyone returning from abroad.</p><p>But just earlier this week, China started allowing foreign travelers from <a href=\"https://www.cbc.ca/news/business/direct-flights-to-beijing-1.5709045\">a very select list of countries back in</a>. For now, they include Canada, Sweden, Australia, and Thailand. Travelers to China must <a href=\"https://hr.cs.mfa.gov.cn/help_two/help-two/gj.html\">submit proof they've tested negative for the virus</a>, before they fly.&#160;</p><p>In contrast, the US had logged more than <a href=\"https://covid19.who.int/table\">42,660 new coronavirus infections</a> in the past 24 hours on Thursday, according to the WHO. Travel bans in the US are weaker, and community spread is broad.</p>\n\tIn South Korea, high-tech thermal camera temperature checks are the new norm. They're not perfect at pinpointing infections, but it's one part of a multi-pronged strategy.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec10e7ed0ee001e25cddf?format=jpeg\" alt=\"south korea covid monitoring\" height=\"1495\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>South Korean actress Eugene walks through a thermal camera system to check her body temperature as she arrives on the red carpet of the 56th annual Daejong Film Awards in Seoul on June 3, 2020 amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jung Yeon-Je/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Temperature checks <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-temperature-scans-are-useless-security-theater-2020-8\">don't have a great track record with the coronavirus</a>, in large part because they can miss so many cases of the virus in people who are sick with a low-grade fever, or no fever at all. However, this is just one tool in South Korea's box.</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tSouth Korea is also using ample testing and contact tracing.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec10fe6ff30001d4e6805?format=jpeg\" alt=\"south korea covid testing\" height=\"1464\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A coronavirus testing station in Seoul on August 26, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jung Yeon-Je/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>According to the <a href=\"http://ncov.mohw.go.kr/en/\">Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention</a>, the country has a roughly 1.1% test positivity rate, compared to the <a href=\"https://coronavirus.jhu.edu/testing/individual-states\">US's 5.5%</a>.</p><p>On Thursday, 195 new cases of the virus were reported nationwide in South Korea.</p><p>The country also takes its <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/south-korea-coronavirus-test-contact-tracing-swab/2020/08/31/a23a2e88-e752-11ea-bf44-0d31c85838a5_story.html\">contact tracing</a> very seriously, helping prevent infections from spreading in a community quickly.&#160;</p>\n\tContact tracing in the US has been hard to carry out as well as South Korea's, in large part because the country's testing system is also flawed.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eb1bda5cdfd48052d365c98?format=jpeg\" alt=\"contact tracing contact tracer coronavirus covid-19\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Medical student Rebecca DeCarlo conducts a follow-up interview with a person being monitored by the Georgia Department of Public Health for infection or exposure to the coronavirus in Savannah, Georgia, on Wednesday, April 22, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Virus-Outbreak-Georgia/413fdc06e8ba43efaf7f03783c4eed86/12/0\" target=\"_blank\">AP Photo/Russ Bynum</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>One of the biggest barriers to contact tracing in the US has been the country's lagging test results, which delay notification of infected individuals, and thus to those who they've been in contact with, by critical days.</p><p>But there are myriad other reasons the US contact tracing system has fallen short too, which include a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-a-contact-tracer-what-they-do-example-call-2020-4\">lack of built-up trust between patients and tracers</a>, a sky high number of infected people, and an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-needs-army-contact-tracers-coronavirus-getting-back-to-normal-2020-4\">inadequate contact tracing workforce</a>.&#160;</p><p>\"It is broken because so many parts of our prevention system are broken.\" Carolyn Cannuscio, a contact tracing expert and associate professor of family medicine and community health at the University of Pennsylvania, recently told the <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/31/health/covid-contact-tracing-tests.html\">New York Times</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tIn the US, coronavirus cases are still spreading rapidly across many states.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f0c6e4b3f73700c076bb25d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"coronavirus testing\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Motorists line up at a drive-through site to collect samples for coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic testing in Leesburg, Virginia, May 20, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>South Dakota and Iowa are seeing some of the nation's most severe surges, with roughly one in four tests performed in those states returning a positive result.</p><p>According to <a href=\"https://graphics.reuters.com/HEALTH-CORONAVIRUS/USA-TRENDS/dgkvlgkrkpb/index.html\">Reuters' coronavirus tracker</a>, both of those states saw their case counts double last week, as more people contracted the virus.</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tSouth Dakota was recently host to a major motorcycle rally in August, where more than 400,000 bikers mingled.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f33fe512618b91158178588?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Sturgis 2020, bikers, South Dakota\" height=\"2422\" width=\"3414\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Every year up to three quarters of a million bikers ride through the scenic Black Hills to Sturgis, South Dakota for its annual motorcycle rally.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jim Urquhart for Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>At least one of the rally attendees has since <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/minnesota-man-died-of-covid-19-after-sturgis-motorcycle-rally-2020-9\">died from COVID-19</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tIn India, where the virus is also spreading fast, the World Health Organization praised one state for its efforts to control the coronavirus.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec10c7ed0ee001e25cddb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"india covid testing \" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A health worker takes a swab sample from a man to test for the coronavirus, as cases continue to spike, at a swab collection center in Guwahati, India on August 31, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Biju Boro/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The state of Gujarat, which has been battling a recent COVID-19 outbreak, has earned praise from health leaders at the WHO for its use of best practices for both detecting and containing the virus.</p><p>\"Our recovery rate now stands at almost 79%,\" Gujarat's Principal Secretary of Health, Jayanti Ravi, told <a href=\"https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/who-lauds-gujarats-efforts-to-contain-coronavirus/articleshow/77659800.cms\">India's Economic Times</a> on August 20. \"Over 51,000 beds are available at present across Gujarat for coronavirus patients.\"</p>\n\tBlow-up clinics are also being used to screen patients, as time is of the essence.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec114e6ff30001d4e6809?format=jpeg\" alt=\"india covid clinic pop up \" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Medical staff from the Tata Memorial Hospital walk past a temporary health facility, which is being used to screen patients for COVID-19 in Mumbai, India on July 30, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Photo by Himanshu Bhatt/NurPhoto via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>On Friday, India <a href=\"https://covid19.who.int/table\">recorded more than 83,300 new infections</a>, double the number of cases diagnosed that same day in the US.&#160;</p><p>According to the Indian government, the case fatality rate in the country, at less than 2%, is improving, in large part because of \"timely and effective clinical management of the patients in critical care,\" but <a href=\"https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(20)31857-2/fulltext?dgcid=raven_jbs_etoc_email\">independent experts are still concerned the Indian death rate</a> may be vastly undercounted.&#160;</p>\n\tMobile testing vans that can deliver results to people on the street (for free, in as little as 15 minutes) are being dispatched by the Indian government.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec110e6ff30001d4e6806?format=jpeg\" alt=\"india mobile covid testing\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>This mobile COVID-19 testing van takes nasal swab samples from patients for Rapid Antigen Testing at Vijay Ghat, Mahatma Gandhi Marg on August 30, 2020 in New Delhi.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mayank Makhija/NurPhoto via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/40-million-rapid-covid-antigen-tests-available-september-less-accurate-2020-8\">rapid antigen tests are not quite as accurate</a> as laboratory testing, but the advantage of <a href=\"https://apnews.com/a87a33e87f50e75199ecd0c3f97130e2\">time is critical</a> as the number of infected people in a population swells.&#160;</p>\n\tIn the US, patients have received surprise medical bills for thousands of dollars after going in for tests and treatment that were supposed to be free.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec424403f737074ca13b843?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Lindsay Hill\" height=\"406\" width=\"484\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Lindsay Hill&#39;s medical bill. She tried to find out whether she had the coronavirus, but was never tested.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Lindsay Hill.</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Despite new measures signed into law to protect people from paying out of pocket for coronavirus tests and treatment, patients are still getting billed, even when they never get tested at all.</p><p>Imad Khachan from New York City told Business Insider's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-patients-medical-bills-hospitals-doctors-insurance-2020-5\">Kimberly Leonard</a> he received a bill for nearly $50,000 after a three-night hospital stay.&#160;</p>\n\tIn France, where coronavirus transmission is still a concern, both students and their teachers are required to wear masks at school this year.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec1037ed0ee001e25cdd9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"france first day of school 2020\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A pupil wearing a protective mask holds a wrapped mask in a classroom at Françoise-Giroud middle school in Vincennes, east of Paris, on September 1, 2020, on the first day of the school year.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Martin Bureau/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Masks are required for all French pupils 11 and up, anytime they're not eating or playing outside, <a href=\"https://www.france24.com/en/20200901-france-s-students-go-back-to-school-amid-concerns-over-covid-19\">France24 reported</a>. Teachers are provided with masks from the government.&#160;</p>\n\tIn the US, where masks are not mandatory at school, one 72-year-old cancer survivor is offering extra credit to his students who wear masks.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f512b907ed0ee001e25d4fe?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2020 school\" height=\"1301\" width=\"1735\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Students wearing face masks arrive at Delaware Valley High School on the first day of school, September 2, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Preston Ehrler/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>\"I would like to stay around a little longer,\" Lawrence Lane, a high school government and history teacher in Oklahoma, told <a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/extra-credit-masks-no-mandates-their-schools-teachers-urge-students-n1235920\">NBC News</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tNot everyone in France is keen on the new mask mandates. This woman is protesting by writing the word \"useless\" in French on her mask. But, she's still wearing it.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec101e6ff30001d4e67ff?format=jpeg\" alt=\"french mask protester\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Hundreds of demonstrators gathered to protest against mask wearing in Paris, France on August 29, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Julien Mattia/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Masks are now required outerwear in Paris. Children under 11 and exercisers jogging and cycling are exempt, but everyone else caught outside maskless may be subject to a <a href=\"https://www.france24.com/en/20200828-face-masks-compulsory-throughout-paris-from-8-am-local-time\">135 Euro fine, France 24 reported</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tTour de France riders are likewise required to mask up this year, whenever they're not racing.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec111e6ff30001d4e6808?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tour de france 2020\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Astana pro team adhering to COVID-19 safety measures during the 107th Tour de France on September 1, 2020 in Orcieres, France.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Stuart Franklin/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The annual road race was <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/greg-lemond-first-only-american-tour-de-france-winner-pandemic-2020-8\">pushed back by two months this year because of the virus</a>, and the tour is only allowing a limited number of spectators to observe the three week course.</p><p>No autographs, and no selfies with the athletes are allowed.&#160;</p>\n\tWorried about a growing number of confirmed infections being reported in recent weeks in Spain, health workers in the northern port city of A Coruña have started testing all young adults.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec1037ed0ee001e25cdd8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"spain testing young people\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A nurse holds up a coronavirus test that she performed on a young man on September 1, 2020 in A Coruña, Spain. More than 3,500 young people between 22 and 25 years old have been summoned to be tested for Covid-19 at the CHUAC University Hospital.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Xurxo Lobato/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://english.elpais.com/society/2020-08-24/why-is-spain-being-hit-again-by-the-coronavirus-pandemic.html\">El Pais reported</a> everyone in the city from the ages of 18 to 40 will be tested, in an effort to <a href=\"https://covid19-country-overviews.ecdc.europa.eu/\">pinpoint potential</a> asymptomatic spreaders.&#160;</p>\n\tMeanwhile in the US, CDC director Robert Redfield recently said \"everyone who wants a test does not necessarily need a test.\"\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f0f56cf2618b920cf550944?format=jpeg\" alt=\"refield coronavirus hospitals hhs \" height=\"600\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Left: Dr. Robert Redfield, Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Right: A healthcare worker gives another a shoulder rub before they go back into the the COVID-19 Unit at United Memorial Medical Center in Houston, Texas, July 2, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Saul Loeb-Pool/Getty Images, Mark Felix/AFP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The CDC's recent shifts in coronavirus testing recommendations \"are frankly not scientifically supportable,\" a former agency <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/former-cdc-director-move-to-end-asymptomatic-testing-unscientific-2020-8\">head told Insider</a>.</p><p>The CDC, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/former-cdc-director-move-to-end-asymptomatic-testing-unscientific-2020-8\">in a surprise move widely criticized by people in public health</a>, changed its own guidance on who should be tested last week, by saying \"you do not necessarily need a test,\" for COVID-19, unless you show symptoms.</p><p>It was a strange protocol adjustment, considering that the agency's own current best estimates suggest <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/hcp/planning-scenarios.html\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-uri=\"89ae91847e7947c9522a3fa9a5dcd20a\">40% of COVID-19 cases may be asymptomatic,</a> and those asymptomatic patients are about 75% as infectious as symptomatic patients, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/who-coronavirus-being-transmitted-by-young-asymptomatic-people-2020-8\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-uri=\"5686e8e141c15faf8eaaaea9ccccc29c\">so they may certainly get others sick</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tMany people in the US still wait multiple days to get their test results back. Bill Gates said it makes the nation's testing system \"absolutely useless.\"\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4e97457ed0ee001e25cc8b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"chicago testing\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>People wait in line in their cars to get tested for COVID-19 at Roseland Community Hospital on April 3, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/people-wait-in-line-in-their-cars-to-get-tested-for-covid-news-photo/1209295157?adppopup=true\" target=\"_blank\">E. Jason Wambsgans/Chicago Tribune/Tribune News Service via Getty Images</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>US coronavirus testing czar Admiral Brett Giroir is promising that millions <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bill-gates-us-coronavirus-testing-system-is-absolutely-useless-slow-2020-7\">more rapid</a>, 15 minute <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/40-million-rapid-covid-antigen-tests-available-september-less-accurate-2020-8\">tests will become available across the US yet this month</a> (especially for workers and residents in nursing homes).&#160;</p>\n\tIn Ghana, drones help deliver test samples to labs from remote health centers.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec110e6ff30001d4e6807?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ghana back to work coronavirus\" height=\"1571\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Steven, a bag seller, poses for a photograph by a wall close to his shop after partial lockdown in parts of Ghana to halt the spread of the coronavirus was lifted in Accra on April 20, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Nipah Dennis/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Ghana, with one of the <a href=\"https://www.pri.org/stories/2020-04-23/fight-against-coronavirus-ghana-uses-drones-speed-testing\">best testing rates</a> in Africa, often <a href=\"https://www.brookings.edu/blog/future-development/2020/07/28/how-well-is-ghana-with-one-of-the-best-testing-capacities-in-africa-responding-to-covid-19/\">uses the so-called \"pooled\" testing approach</a>, whereby samples from multiple individuals are combined and tested together, to increase capacity and provide results more quickly too.</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tScientists in Senegal have been testing out a new kind of rapid coronavirus test this summer, which would cost $1, and could deliver results in 10 minutes.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec0ffe6ff30001d4e67fd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"senegal clinic coronavirus\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A hygienist is seen inside a decontamination area in a coronavirus treatment centre that cares for positive patients that show few or no symptoms, in Dakar on June 26, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">John Wessels/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/04/senegal-trials-1-covid-19-test-kit-200428132313740.html\">Regular</a>&#160;coronavirus tests in Senegal (which require more extensive lab work) cost 40,000 West African CFA francs (around $72) <a href=\"https://sn.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/\">the US embassy in Senegal says</a> on its website.</p>\n\tSenegal also promised early-on in the pandemic that it would aim to provide a hospital bed to every coronavirus patient, and offer isolation to their close contacts, too.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec10ce6ff30001d4e6801?format=jpeg\" alt=\"senegal clinics for mildly infected\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A hygienist rests as he waits outside a decontamination area in a coronavirus treatment centre that cares for positive patients that show mild or no symptoms, in Dakar on June 26, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">John Wessels/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Coronavirus treatment centers are open to aid patients with mild symptoms of the virus, or even no symptoms at all.</p><p>\"We can stop the fire in our country, but the fire is still going in other countries,\" Dr Abdoulaye Bousso, director of the Senegal Health Emergency Operations Center in Dakar, told <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2020/05/17/856016429/senegal-pledges-a-bed-for-every-coronavirus-patient-and-their-contacts-too\">NPR in May</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tIt's a stark contrast to the US, where people seeking care for severe infections have often been turned away, told to stay home and rest.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e84b53f487c224e10540242?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Aria Bendix in hospital\" height=\"3088\" width=\"2316\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Aria Bendix/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>That's what happened to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-patient-experience-new-york-emergency-room-test-2020-4\">Business Insider science reporter Aria Bendix</a>, when she arrived at a busy ER in New York in March gasping for breath, her ribs burning.&#160;</p>\n\tGhana is also stepping up manufacturing of PPE for the coronavirus, with factories commissioned by the government to manufacture more protective gear for healthcare workers.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec10e7ed0ee001e25cddd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ghana masks for frontline workers\" height=\"1571\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Factory workers check PPE made for coronavirus frontline health workers at a factory commissioned by the government, in Accra, on April 17, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Nipah Dennis/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The government is also helping people pay their water and electric bills during the pandemic: 50% off for all homes and businesses, and 100% off \"for the very poor,\" as the Brookings <a href=\"https://www.brookings.edu/blog/future-development/2020/07/28/how-well-is-ghana-with-one-of-the-best-testing-capacities-in-africa-responding-to-covid-19/\">Institution reported in July</a>.</p>\n\tIn the US, many first responders have had to pay for their own protective gear, or resort to trash bags, and defective gowns from the government.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f513073e6ff30001d4e6ea0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Faulty PPE\" height=\"1423\" width=\"1898\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brendan Williams/New Hampshire Health Care Association</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>\"To suggest that they should wear garbage bags &#8212; or, perhaps worse, didn't know how to wear garbage bags &#8212; is symbolic of the long-standing government marginalization of a workforce that cares for a population that is predominantly Medicaid,\" Brendan Williams, President &#38; CEO of&#160;<a href=\"https://www.nhhca.org/about/board-staff/\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"e8cf22170d67c33b5455dea4676b7f6d\">the New Hampshire Health Care Association,</a> told <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/photos-faulty-ppe-sent-to-us-care-homes-gowns-masks-2020-7\">Insider, after receiving two shipments of unusable PPE from FEMA in May and June</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tIn Senegal, worshippers conduct their prayers outside, where there's plenty of air circulation.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec10de6ff30001d4e6803?format=jpeg\" alt=\"senegal social distancing prayer\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Followers of the Layene community wore protective masks as they prayed on the beach in front of the Yoff Layene Mosque on May 24, 2020 in Dakar, Senegal.\n<p class=\"copyright\">John Wessels/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Muslims in Senegal ended their holy month of Ramadan in late May this year by celebrating Korit&#233; with a bit more distance than usual, as <a href=\"https://www.osac.gov/Content/Report/71a4d3b3-ad35-4ee7-b68a-18beb43a27ec\">very little travel was permitted between different regions of the country, to stem the spread of the virus</a>.</p>\n\tWhile in the US, reopened churches have played host to several major coronavirus superspreader events.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec70750f34d057b21040d02?format=jpeg\" alt=\"churches coronavirus lockdown first amendment\" height=\"1570\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Parishioners wear face masks as they attend an in-person Mass at Christ the King Catholic Church in San Antonio, Texas, on May 19, 2020. San Antonio parishes that have been closed during the pandemic have began opening their doors to in-person services.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Eric Gay/AP Photo</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>People who've attended faith services indoors in the US this year, from churches in Arkansas and Chicago to a synagogue in New York, have caught the virus from their fellow parishioners, after huddling inside, in poorly-ventilated spaces, to share the air as they pray, talk, and sing.&#160;</p><p>\"People congregate, hug each other, exchange stories, and thank you very much, the virus is going to go from me to you,\" William Schaffner, an infectious-disease expert from Vanderbilt University, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/houses-of-worship-trump-says-essential-coronavirus-hotspots-2020-5\">previously told Business Insider</a>.</p>\n\tSouth of the border, in Matamoros, Mexico, roughly 1,500 people are living in tents, awaiting asylum hearings. Very few have gotten the virus.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ea10e7ed0ee001e25ccec?format=jpeg\" alt=\"mexico border coronavirus isolation tents\" height=\"600\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>In Matamoros, Mexico on the US border, 1,500 asylum seekers living in tents await their hearings. These July 13, 2020 photos show a couple wearing face masks waiting outside their isolation tent (right), and a yellow fence demarcating the edge of the isolation area.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lexie Harrison-Cripps/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The low infection rate is likely helped by the fact that asylum seekers live largely outdoors, wear masks, and are relatively young and healthy too, <a href=\"https://slate.com/technology/2020/08/matamoros-avoided-covid-outbreak-migrants-mexico.html\">as Slate recently reported</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tJust north of them, across the Rio Grande, Texas continues to lead the nation in coronavirus cases, adding more than 33,500 new cases last week (only California had more).\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f200975aee6a855ed2d0df5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"texas coronavirus\" height=\"1333\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Medical staff wearing full PPE push a stretcher with a deceased patient to a car outside of the Covid-19 intensive care unit at the United Memorial Medical Center on June 30, 2020 in Houston, Texas.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/medical-staff-wearing-full-ppe-push-a-stretcher-with-a-news-photo/1223660364?adppopup=true\" target=\"_blank\">Go Nakamura/Getty Images</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner recently blamed a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-texas-coronavirus-outbreak-got-out-of-control-2020-7\">rushed statewide reopening plan</a> for the high <a href=\"https://graphics.reuters.com/HEALTH-CORONAVIRUS/USA-TRENDS/dgkvlgkrkpb/index.html\">case count, and death toll</a> in his state.&#160;</p><p>\"People thought everything was fine &#8212; the wrong signals were sent,\" Turner recently told <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/houston-mayor-accuses-texas-governor-of-undermining-coronavirus-effort-2020-8\">Business Insider</a>. \"I don't really blame the people because if you start opening up, they just assume everything is fine.\"</p>\n\tIn New Zealand, where reopenings were not as rushed as in Texas, the country had an enviable run of 102 days virus-free starting June 8.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec1097ed0ee001e25cdda?format=jpeg\" alt=\"new zealand totally normal\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>People cheer at the start of a 5K run around Western Springs Park on July 4, 2020 in Auckland, New Zealand.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Phil Walter/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jacinda-ardern-dance-for-new-zealand-beating-coronavirus-2020-6\">New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said that she</a> \"did a little dance\" when she heard the news that all coronavirus restrictions could be lifted, as the country's <a href=\"https://www.health.govt.nz/news-media/media-releases/no-active-cases-covid-19\">last remaining case was declared symptom-free</a>.</p>\n\tFrom June 8 to August 11, New Zealanders kissed and hugged blissfully, having eliminated the virus from their shores entirely.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec10ee6ff30001d4e6804?format=jpeg\" alt=\"new zealand vulnerable safe\" height=\"1467\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sue Eng is reunited with her 8 month old grandson Soren Walter on May 14, 2020 in Auckland, New Zealand, after two months of lockdown.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Phil Walter/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Fans also packed into sports stadiums <a href=\"https://www.tampabay.com/news/health/2020/06/13/fans-pack-stadium-for-return-of-rugby-in-coronavirus-free-new-zealand/\">to watch games, without worry</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tEven when the virus did return in August, New Zealand had a clear plan in place to control it.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4ec0ffe6ff30001d4e67fe?format=jpeg\" alt=\"new zealand new cases \" height=\"1466\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern wears a mask meeting Auckland Mayor Phil Goff during a visit to Crave Cafe on August 31, 2020 in Auckland, New Zealand. Face coverings are now compulsory for all New Zealanders over the age of 12 on public transport or planes under current Alert Level restrictions in place across the country.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hannah Peters/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>\"After 102 days, we have our first cases of COVID-19 outside of a managed isolation or quarantine facility in New Zealand,\" <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yIKFeNTw1hU\">Prime Minister Jacinda</a> Ardern <a href=\"https://covid19.govt.nz/alert-system/alert-level-2/\">announced</a> the evening of August 11, ending the streak. \"While we have all worked incredibly hard to prevent this scenario, we have also planned and prepared for it.\"</p><p>Gatherings in the capital of Auckland (where the August <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/08/11/901304243/new-zealand-on-alert-after-4-cases-of-covid-19-emerge-from-an-unknown-source\">outbreak originated</a>) are still limited to 10 people, and everyone traveling on public transport throughout the country must wear a face covering.</p><p>The number of active coronavirus cases in the country (<a href=\"https://www.health.govt.nz/our-work/diseases-and-conditions/covid-19-novel-coronavirus/covid-19-current-situation/covid-19-current-cases\">at 112 infections as of Friday afternoon in New Zealand</a>) is on a downward trend, and there's only one cluster of cases, that \"Auckland August Cluster.\" The source of infection for the cluster, which has so far sickened more than 150 people, is still under investigation.</p>\n\tMany Americans still grumble about an action as simple and effective as putting their masks on.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4e9d33e6ff30001d4e66e9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"mask wars coronavirus\" height=\"600\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Left: workers protest a lack of PPE and sick pay in the Bronx, New York, on April 17, 2020. Right: a pro-Trump, anti-mask protester.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Giles Clarke/Getty Images, Sergio Flores/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Masks or no masks, the coronavirus outbreak could get much worse across the US, in the months to come.</p><p>Bill Gates told Business Insider he was baffled by the resistance.</p><p>\"The sacrifice of wearing a mask is almost so trivial that you almost hate to use the word 'sacrifice,'\" he said.</p><p>\"The fall could be tough, we'll be indoors more, it will be colder &#8212; we know those are things that push the disease up,\" <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bill-gates-coronavirus-interview-vaccines-masks-and-us-leadership-2020-7\">Gates said</a>. All indications so far suggest Americans are probably not ready for it.&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tDwayne 'The Rock' Johnson, who is recovering from COVID, agrees with Gates: It's time for America to mask up, and for all politicians to start taking this pandemic seriously.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f513e7e7ed0ee001e25d577?format=jpeg\" alt=\"the rock\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Dwayne &#39;The Rock&#39; Johnson is recovering from COVID-19, along with his wife, and two girls.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Art Streiber/NBCUniversal via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>\"Wear your mask,\"<a href=\"https://www.insider.com/dwayne-the-rock-johnson-family-had-covid-19-slams-politicians-2020-9\">Johnson reiterated in a recent Instagram video</a>, announcing his entire family was recovering from COVID-19 infections.</p><p>\"It has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/anti-maskers-are-new-anti-vaxxers-threatening-public-health-coronavirus-2020-7\">nothing to do with politics</a>. Wear your mask. It is a fact. And it is the right thing to do, not only for yourself, but for your family and your loved ones, and also for your fellow human beings.\"</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original 278d0f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn78@2020_1/2020/09/06/02-59-58-308_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Redw5JrCwIY:O-BnOtxIFXc:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn58@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-59-059_e512c6e4d5633114.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Redw5JrCwIY:O-BnOtxIFXc:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn81@2020_5/2020/09/06/02-59-54-548_5111b577dd672b0f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn60@2020_6/2020/09/06/02-59-52-353_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Redw5JrCwIY:O-BnOtxIFXc:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn36@2020_1/2020/09/06/02-59-49-278_d9d8aeb3b7d83b3e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Redw5JrCwIY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn68@2020_3/2020/09/06/02-59-52-336_8374d3fbc222ef29.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1599361164665},{"createdTime":"2020-09-06 10:59:24","updatedTime":"2020-09-06 10:59:24","title":"San Francisco's Sea Cliff neighborhood, where Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey owns $30 million worth of homes, is a parade of oceanside mansions. Here's what it's like inside.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-its-like-san-francisco-sea-cliff-neighborhood-2020-2","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3cb70ae35bab77a1623283?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 21\" height=\"1332\" width=\"1776\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, Robin Williams, and Metallica&#39;s Kirk Hammett have all called Sea Cliff home at one point.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>On the northwest corner of San Francisco lies the exclusive neighborhood of Sea Cliff.</li><li>It was founded in 1913 as one of the city's residence parks, or makeshift suburbs.</li><li>It's become one of San Francisco's most elite residential areas housing prominent figures, including Twitter and Square founder and billionaire Jack Dorsey.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>If you need a reminder of San Francisco's multifaceted landscape, go to Sea Cliff.&#160;</p><p>As the name implies, it's a neighborhood built on, and in some parts into, a cliff overlooking the expansive Pacific Ocean. It's on the opposite side of the city center, away from the hustle and bustle — you'll get a hefty whiff of salt and brush of sea breeze by merely wandering its streets.</p><p>Notable residents that have at one point owned property here <a href=\"https://www.sfgate.com/realestate/article/140-Sea-Cliff-Ave-San-Francisco-real-estate-14021016.php\">include actors</a> Robin Williams, <a href=\"https://www.sfgate.com/news/article/Sea-Cliff-row-heats-up-over-house-addition-3088130.php#\">Sharon Stone</a> with then-husband Phil Bronstein — who was the executive editor for the San Francisco Examiner — Cheech Marin, and Eugene Levy; musicians Paul Kantner of Jefferson Airplane and Kirk Hammett of Metallica, prominent photographer <a href=\"https://sf.curbed.com/2013/9/23/10195118/ansel-adams-childhood-home-hidden-in-sea-cliff\">Ansel Adams</a>, and Bay Area tech bigwigs like Twitter and Square founder and CEO and billionaire Jack Dorsey, <a href=\"https://variety.com/2019/dirt/real-estate/jack-dorsey-house-san-francisco-1203231862/?mod=article_inline\">who reportedly paid a collective $30 million</a> for two homes next door to each other, both nestled into a cliffside overlooking the Pacific Ocean.</p><p>It's a coveted neighborhood, Sotheby's real-estate agent Anne Herrera told Business Insider <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/sea-cliff-mansion-san-francisco-lucky-luke-2019-10\">in a 2019 interview.</a></p><p>\"It has become a place for those that have the means to do so to buy a house and still be in the city, but still be very connected to nature and all the beauty of the views of the bridge and the beach,\" Herrera said.</p><p>We spent a day meandering through the neighborhood's streets in early 2020, down El Camino Del Mar, Sea Cliff Avenue, and into the public cove of China Beach where Jack Dorsey's home is visible.</p><p>It's a breathtaking part of San Francisco — here's what it's like inside.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tSea Cliff is a neighborhood on the northwest corner of San Francisco.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5db316ccdee0193031585753?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sea cliff lucky luke san francisco 16\" height=\"1000\" width=\"1333\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Homes are seen built into the cliffside in Sea Cliff.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Open Homes Photography for Sotheby&#39;s International Realty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Sea Cliff was founded in 1913 as one of San Francisco's eight <a href=\"https://sfgov.org/sfplanningarchive/residence-parks-historic-context-statement\">master-planned residence parks</a>, or \"garden suburbs.\"</p><p>Fast forward to today, and it's still as peaceful as it was when it was built.&#160;</p>\n\tBut what was originally intended to be merely a reprieve from city life has transformed into one of 21st century San Francisco's most elite neighborhoods thanks in part to the proximity to the ocean.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3dc1dbe35bab33226f9fb3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 54\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Pacific seen from a lookout point in Land&#39;s End.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Some of the most beautiful vantage points of San Francisco, the Golden Gate Bridge, and the Pacific Ocean are in Sea Cliff.</p>\n\tAnd some of the highest-priced and most coveted homes in the city are located here.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3dc2e60ce3d132b44bae77?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 13\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The roof of a Sea Cliff home peeks out from a hedge.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tSea Cliff itself technically covers a larger area of the city than just the main residential area. Land's End, Sutro Baths, the Legion of Honor museum, and other attractions are lumped into the neighborhood.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3d9fc6e35bab7ed62e3d26?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 47\" height=\"1332\" width=\"1776\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Lincoln Park Steps.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut many of the Sea Cliff homes are concentrated in the east part of the neighborhood.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3da983d9db1d0a22521618?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 68\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>One of Sea Cliff&#39;s many tony homes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWeaving through the streets of San Francisco's exclusive Sea Cliff neighborhood is like walking through a surreal museum of lavish homes.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3da3b7d9db1d01392482a8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 62\" height=\"1332\" width=\"1776\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Homes along Lake Street in Sea Cliff.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWe visited on a Tuesday afternoon in February, in the middle of a workday, so the neighborhood seemed void of all residents.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3da8f1d9db1d09451af004?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 3\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Cars are parked along a street in Sea Cliff.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThough it seemed as though many homes haven't been occupied in a while — there were still pumpkins on display at this home, but perhaps the live-in owners are simply busy.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3d9507e35bab70d456c387?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 65\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A home had five pumpkins atop a wall and on its porch.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere was, however, no shortage of landscapers and contractors, working hard to manicure the pristine lawns and conducting renovations — some inside, some out — on the exquisite homes.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3da9300ce3d10bfa2a1b64?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 59\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The intersection of El Camino Del Mar and 32nd Avenue.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe layout of the residential streets is indeed reminiscent of suburban design — the streets and sidewalks were narrower than what you would find in a city setting, and trees were symmetrically lined along the roads.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3da996e35bab0e1621a974?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 66\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Neat lawns surround a sidewalk in the neighborhood.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tHomes here sell on average for $4.2 million. That's well above San Francisco's median home value of $1.45 million.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3da9c2d9db1d0a8803a262?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 4\" height=\"1332\" width=\"1776\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Homes in Sea Cliff.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.zillow.com/seacliff-san-francisco-ca/home-values/\">Zillow</a> and <a href=\"https://www.zillow.com/san-francisco-ca/home-values/\">Zillow</a></em></p>\n\tOne of the most expensive homes currently for sale publicly is a four-story white home built in 1915 that is listed for $8.8 million with unobscured views of the bay and the Golden Gate Bridge.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3d9e33e35bab7cbe3708da?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 67\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A home on Sea Cliff Avenue.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>It was listed on February 3, its first time on the public market, according to public records.</p><p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/10-Sea-Cliff-Ave-San-Francisco-CA-94121/15088581_zpid/\">Zillow</a></em></p>\n\tEl Camino Del Mar — Spanish for \"the way or path of the sea\" — is the main thoroughfare in Sea Cliff, cutting east to west from the Presidio and into Land's End.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3d9ec2e35bab7d6f526473?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 61\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>El Camino Del Mar is wider than many of the streets in Sea Cliff.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tPalm trees, Spanish tile roofing, and red-bricked porches are common sights along the road, and throughout the neighborhood.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3da0a60ce3d17e095ce8d9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 39\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A home on El Camino Del Mar.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThis Spanish-style four-bedroom home on El Camino Del Mar was built in 1924 and last sold for $6 million in December 2014.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3da154d9db1d7cda342064?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 63\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The home on El Camino Del Mar.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.redfin.com/CA/San-Francisco/549-El-Camino-Del-Mar-94121/home/2007666\">Redfin</a></em></p>\n\tZillow estimates that this two-story yellow home built in 1927 with 12 rooms is estimated to be worth $6.6 million, though it's not for sale.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3d958de35bab717b1a3fc4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 42\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The home on El Camino Del Mar.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/625-El-Camino-Del-Mar-San-Francisco-CA-94121/15088837_zpid/\">Zillow</a></em></p>\n\tA few doors down is an 18-room, rose-colored manor built in 1926 that occupies nearly half an acre on a corner lot. It's currently off the market but estimates by Zillow and Redfin value it at $8.8 million and $9.6 million, respectively.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3da51f0ce3d105e81f9e43?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 15\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The mansion on El Camino Del Mar.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/540-El-Camino-Del-Mar-San-Francisco-CA-94121/15088724_zpid/\">Zillow</a> and <a href=\"https://www.redfin.com/CA/San-Francisco/540-El-Camino-Del-Mar-94121/home/604598\">Redfin</a></em></p>\n\tMost of the Sea Cliff homes are of Spanish, Mediterranean, or the city's signature Victorian design.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3da0820ce3d17dc33c3afe?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 43\" height=\"1332\" width=\"1776\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Homes near the intersection of McLaren Avenue and El Camino Del Mar.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBut some are modern — this home last sold on the public market for $3 million in 2010.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3d91670ce3d168d149a5ba?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 40\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The home on El Camino Del Mar.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.redfin.com/CA/San-Francisco/535-El-Camino-Del-Mar-94121/home/1163154\">Redfin</a></em></p>\n\tThe two-story home was originally built in 1951 and has three bedrooms and three bathrooms.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3dacb80ce3d110f87f9b8c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 41\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Large windows in the home.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.redfin.com/CA/San-Francisco/535-El-Camino-Del-Mar-94121/home/1163154\">Redfin</a></em></p>\n\tThere are smaller arteries branching out from El Camino Del Mar like 32nd Avenue, a street running perpendicular to the coast that might be one of the quaintest.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3da3ca0ce3d103eb15c488?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 46\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Homes along 32nd Avenue in Sea Cliff.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAt the northern end along a bend in the road is a home that was once a Danish consulate. It was owned by a Google lawyer and the founder of shoe startup Rothy's in 2016 when a driver crashed into the house.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3d914ae35bab6ac0544eb9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 57\" height=\"1054\" width=\"1405\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Sea Cliff home on 32nd Avenue.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://sf.curbed.com/2018/5/2/17312584/sea-cliff-sf-house-mansion-fire-damaged-renovation\">Curbed SF</a></em></p>\n\tThey sold their home, which was damaged by a fire that erupted from the crash, in mid-2017 for over asking price for $3.1 million, less than a month after it was first listed. The ad came with disclaimers like \"sold as is\" and \"buyer beware.\"\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3db0fdd9db1d14d26e51b4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 58\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The left side of the home on 32nd Avenue.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The new owners renovated it and, less than a year later in April 2018, listed it for sale for $6.5 million. A founder of a New York startup investment firm snagged it three months later for $6.75 million, according to public records.</p><p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.redfin.com/CA/San-Francisco/182-32nd-Ave-94121/home/1341442\">Redfin</a> and <a href=\"https://sf.curbed.com/2018/5/2/17312584/sea-cliff-sf-house-mansion-fire-damaged-renovation\">Curbed SF</a></em></p>\n\tIf you head back up to El Camino Del Mar and turn right, the street will eventually merge into Sea Cliff Avenue, a street running parallel to the coast at the northern end of residential Sea Cliff.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3db10cd9db1d14ea4890c3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 6\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Golden Gate Bridge looms in the distance.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe homes on this street have front-row seats to the Pacific Ocean and are some of the only homes to be literally built into the cliffside.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3d9283d9db1d694d6cc9f3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 12\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The ocean is in view beyond a pair of gates to a home on Sea Cliff Avenue.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe pink home at 224 Sea Cliff Avenue, a \"fixer-upper\" according to a 2019 Business Insider interview with the home's listing agent, is in serious need of some TLC and doesn't even come with photos of the interior.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5db3162edee0192e671128c5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sea cliff lucky luke san francisco 9\" height=\"1000\" width=\"1333\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The home at 224 Sea Cliff Avenue.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Open Homes Photography for Sotheby&#39;s International Realty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/sea-cliff-mansion-san-francisco-lucky-luke-2019-10\">Business Insider</a></em></p>\n\tAnd yet it's listed for sale for $13.1 million, though it was listed in July to be sold at a foreclosure auction. It comes with a winding pathway down to a secluded seaside cove.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3db5d3e35bab20794986d8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sea cliff lucky luke san francisco 8\" height=\"1000\" width=\"1333\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The winding pink pathway leads to a secluded cove.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Open Homes Photography for Sotheby&#39;s International Realty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/224-Sea-Cliff-Ave-San-Francisco-CA-94121/15088697_zpid/\">Zillow</a></em></p>\n\tIt was once owned by Luke \"Lucky Luke\" Bragnara, a real-estate mogul and notorious art scammer who stashed hordes of stolen art worth a collective $11 million in the home in 2014.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3db8230ce3d1222c6120c9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sea cliff lucky luke san francisco 18\" height=\"1000\" width=\"1333\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The home at 224 Sea Cliff Avenue.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Open Homes Photography for Sotheby&#39;s International Realty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>He was sentenced to a seven-year jail term for fraud. A series of liens placed on the home caused it to struggle to sell until October 2019 when it cropped back up on the market as a bankruptcy sale.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/sea-cliff-mansion-san-francisco-lucky-luke-2019-10\">This dilapidated $15 million mansion built into a San Francisco cliffside once housed 'Lucky Luke's' stolen art &#8212; now it's for sale</a></em></p>\n\tA few doors down and across the street is this two-story, five-bedroom house that doesn't face the water. It last sold on the public market in 2013 for $3.2 million.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3d9f8dd9db1d7a761727b4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 11\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The home on Sea Cliff Avenue.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/115-Sea-Cliff-Ave-San-Francisco-CA-94121/15088663_zpid/\">Zillow</a></em></p>\n\tDown the street is not one but two homes next door to each other once owned by Metallica guitarist Kirk Hammett.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3da3ef0ce3d10413133359?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 64\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A wall conceals part of this home, one of Hammett&#39;s past abodes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The home at 308 Sea Cliff Avenue sold in March 2018 for $12.8 million. And, according to Socketsite, the other home at 320 Sea Cliff sold in early 2019 for nearly $12 million.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/320-Sea-Cliff-Ave-San-Francisco-CA-94121/15088693_zpid/?\">Photos in the listings</a> show breathtaking ocean views from the inside of both homes.</p><p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://sf.curbed.com/2016/12/21/14045572/320-sea-cliff-16-million\">Curbed SF</a>, <a href=\"https://sf.curbed.com/2017/12/11/16762426/kirk-hammett-metallica-san-francisco-home-house-sale\">Curbed SF</a>, <a href=\"https://www.redfin.com/CA/San-Francisco/308-Sea-Cliff-Ave-94121/home/1992183\">Redfin</a>, and <a href=\"https://socketsite.com/archives/2019/02/rock-stars-second-sea-cliff-mansion-finally-fetches-11-7-million.html\">Socketsite</a></em></p>\n\tWalk around the corner from Hammett's previous homes and down a short path, and China Beach will begin to come into view.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3d83440ce3d1559b00d95b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 17\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The beach visible from Sea Cliff Avenue.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt's a cove open to the public and nestled at the northern end of the residential area of Sea Cliff.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3dcef3e35bab43e33ec7a7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 32\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Golden Gate Bridge is seen from China Beach.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tA winding staircase leads down from the street level to the beach.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3dcf2be35bab442463f522?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 23\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The path to the beach.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe beach's history is engraved on a stone at the entrance. According to local legend, Chinese fishermen once used it as a campground while anchoring their fishing boats in the cove.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3d88700ce3d15d4b514087?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 18\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A stone marker at the entrance to Ocean Beach.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.parksconservancy.org/parks/china-beach\">Golden Gate National Parks Conservancy</a></em></p>\n\tLegend or not, the plaque was erected by Chinese Americans in 1982 to honor the Chinese fisherman that contributed to the San Francisco Bay Area since the time of the Gold Rush.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3dbbb30ce3d127e42a2f82?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 26\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A seabird flies low over the water at China Beach.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.nps.gov/goga/learn/historyculture/vestiges-china-beach.htm\">National Park Service</a></em></p>\n\tDown near the beach, there's a deteriorating structure once used by lifeguards to store equipment.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3dbbedd9db1d25bf716dc4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 25\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The structure stands with one of Hammett&#39;s homes (to the far left) in the background.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://sf.curbed.com/2012/5/9/10372780/china-beach-in-sea-cliff\">Curbed SF</a></em></p>\n\tStanding in the alcove of China Beach's public sand is a surreal feeling similar to touring the neighborhood, like you're on a stage with the homes tucked away in the hillsides staring down at you.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3dbc370ce3d1289358ae34?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 36\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Homes are tucked into the hills in Sea Cliff.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOn one side of the amphitheater are four homes, the left two once belonging to Hammett, the Metallica bassist.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3dbc8a0ce3d1293868d242?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 31\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Not pictured: one more home on the tip of the cliff to the far left.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tPivot in the opposite direction and there, peeking out from the foliage, is the roof of a home belonging to Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey. It's a two-bedroom, two-bathroom house clad in dark wood. Dorsey purchased it in 2012 for $10 million.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3dbf71d9db1d2b8f7da77b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 38\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The roof of one of Dorsey&#39;s Sea Cliff homes juts out from the foliage.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://variety.com/2019/dirt/real-estate/jack-dorsey-house-san-francisco-1203231862/?mod=article_inline\">Variety</a></em></p>\n\tAnd in November 2019, he reportedly bought the two-story house right next door in an off-market sale for $21 million, perhaps for more privacy — the second house is wedged in right alongside his home of eight years, though it's difficult to catch sight of that one from the beach.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3dbdea0ce3d12adb721509?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 33\" height=\"1332\" width=\"1776\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>One of Dorsey&#39;s Sea Cliff homes is visible from the beach.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>It was the highest price ever paid for a property in the Sea Cliff neighborhood, according to Variety.</p><p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://variety.com/2019/dirt/real-estate/jack-dorsey-house-san-francisco-1203231862/?mod=article_inline\">Variety</a></em></p>\n\tThe newly purchased home was in need of a restoration, with one building complaint claiming that the property had gone unoccupied for 15 years, according to Mansion Global.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3dd05fd9db1d428515600f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 24\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Dorsey&#39;s home peeking out from its perch.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>It has five bedrooms and three bathrooms and was built in 1962.</p><p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.mansionglobal.com/articles/remodel-underway-at-jack-dorseys-new-21-million-house-203678\">Mansion Global</a></em></p>\n\tNeither home was visible from the street, but there were workers and construction equipment and materials along the street where the entrances would be.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3dbffa0ce3d12e6d250092?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 60\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Not Dorsey&#39;s home — his properties are to the left of this home on El Camino Del Mar.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tDorsey reportedly is turning the two homes into a single compound.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3dc020d9db1d2cc66630e5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 35\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Dorsey&#39;s home is to the upper left.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.mansionglobal.com/articles/remodel-underway-at-jack-dorseys-new-21-million-house-203678\">Mansion Global</a> and <a href=\"https://variety.com/2019/dirt/real-estate/jack-dorsey-house-san-francisco-1203231862/?mod=article_inline\">Variety</a></em></p>\n\tWith views like this, it's not unheard of for one of the richest men in tech — and the world — to opt for such a living situation in one of the most beautiful parts of Square and Twitter's hometown.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e3dc05ce35bab30c542e1a2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"san francisco sea cliff neighborhood jack dorsey 30\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Golden Gate Bridge is seen from China Beach.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Katie Canales/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fabulous-life-of-billionaire-jack-dorsey-taking-square-public\">Business Insider</a></em></p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a data-type=\"h2\">\n Table of Contents: Static\n</bi-shortcode>\n<p>Labor Day weekend provides shoppers an opportunity to save on anything they need to buy online.</p>\n<p>While Labor Day falls on September 7 this year, shoppers can save big on tech, mattresses, clothing, and more before this Monday.&nbsp;To make shopping easier, we're rounding up the best sales and deals all happening online ahead of the weekend. We'll routinely update this post with more coverage in the days leading up to the big holiday weekend.</p>\n<p>To potentially save more during Labor Day, you can visit our <a href=\"https://coupons.businessinsider.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">coupons site</a> to find promo codes to these retailers.&nbsp;</p>\n<h2>When do Labor Day sales start in 2020?</h2>\n<p>Labor Day sales typically start the week before Labor Day, which falls on Monday, September 7 this year. Most sales run through the weekend, but some continue to run for a couple of days afterward, giving shoppers a full week or more in some cases to take advantage of deals.</p>\n<h2>What types of deals will I find over Labor Day weekend?</h2>\n<p>Most online retailers offer discounts for Labor Day. Shoppers can expect big discounts on tech, clothes, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-mattress\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">mattresses</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/labor-day-furniture-sales\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">furniture</a> and home goods, outdoor gear, and more during the week leading up to and following Labor Day weekend.</p>\n<p>Labor Day weekend is one of the best times in the year to shop online for furniture, appliances, and outdoor gear.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>If you're shopping for fall-friendly attire, it's also a solid time to refresh your wardrobe. src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=WfZwVCmZPVk:o8F7HtIOwng:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n  <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=WfZwVCmZPVk:o8F7HtIOwng:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n  <a
